sentences.sContent: She sat there staring into space (= looking for a long time at nothing ) .
sentences.sCn: 她坐在那里，出神地凝视前方。

sentences.sContent: ...it will inevitably affect people’s health if they sit before computers and stare at the screens for long hours...
...Several of the employees in the computer department claim to be developing vision problems from having to stare at a video display terminal for about 7 hours a day...

phrases.pCn: 遵循先例；（拉）[律]根据过去判例

words.tran: 凝视的，目不转睛的；瞪着眼的；显眼的
凝视；盯着看；显眼（stare的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored
